title: 109_hr5811
content:
The Act titled "MARPOL Annex VI Implementation Act of 2006" references the Act to Prevent Pollution from Ships (33 U.S.C. 1901 et seq.) for amendments or repeals. It also includes definitions. SEC. 3. DEFINITIONS. Section 2(a) (33 U.S.C. 1901(a)) is amended to include new definitions and redesignate existing paragraphs. SEC. 4. APPLICABILITY. Section 3 (33 U.S.C. 1902) is amended to include regulations regarding Annex VI to the Convention for ships in specific locations within the United States. Section 3 (33 U.S.C. 1902) is amended to include regulations regarding Annex VI to the Convention for ships in specific locations within the United States. The amendment designates emission control areas and areas of concern for ship emissions based on scientific data. The head of a Federal department or agency may decide to apply some or all requirements of the Act to certain classes of public vessels. Amendments to subsection (d) include references to the Administrator and specific Annexes under the MARPOL Protocol. SEC. 5. ADMINISTRATION AND ENFORCEMENT. Section 4(b) (33 U.S.C. 1903(b)) is amended to consult with relevant authorities on regulations for Annex VI to the Convention. The Administrator, in consultation with the Secretary, will also prescribe necessary regulations for specific provisions of the Annex. No standard issued by any person or Federal agency regarding. No standard issued by any person or Federal agency regarding emissions from tank vessels subject to Regulation 15 of Annex VI to the Convention shall be effective until six months after the Secretary notifies the International Maritime Organization of the established standard. SEC. 6. CERTIFICATES. In Section 5 of the amendment, the Administrator is authorized to issue Engine International Air Pollution Prevention Certificates in accordance with specific regulations. The Administrator can issue certificates under the MARPOL Protocol, which have the same validity as certificates issued under the Act. Additionally, subsection (e) is amended to include protection of public health or welfare after the marine environment. SEC. 7. RECEPTION FACILITIES. Section 6 (33 U.S.C. 1905) is amended to require ports and terminals to provide reception facilities for ozone depleting substances, equipment, and exhaust gas cleaning residues. The Secretary may establish regulations to certify the adequacy of these facilities. The Secretary may deny entry of ships to ports or terminals lacking adequate reception facilities for garbage, ozone depleting substances, equipment, and exhaust gas cleaning residues. Additionally, regulations may require compliance with MARPOL Protocol, Antarctic Protocol, or this Act. SEC. 8. INSPECTIONS.

    The Secretary may inspect ships to verify compliance with Annex VI to the Convention and this Act, and take enforcement action if violations are found.

SEC. 9. AMENDMENTS TO THE PROTOCOL.

    Amendments include adding Annex VI to the list of protocols in Section 10(b).

SEC. 10. EFFECT ON OTHER LAWS.

    Section 15 is amended to address the impact on other laws. Section 15 (33 U.S.C. 1911) is amended to state that the authorities, requirements, and remedies of this Act supplement and do not amend or repeal any other authorities, requirements, or remedies under different laws. The Act does not limit, deny, amend, modify, or repeal any other authority, requirement, or remedy available to the United States or any other person, except as expressly provided in this Act. Additionally, technical corrections are made to section 9 (33 U.S.C. 1908) by removing the second comma after "MARPOL Protocol" in subsections (a), (b), and (d).
